text: The Book of the Law is the central sacred text of Thelema, written by Aleister Crowley in Cairo, Egypt in the year 1904. Its full title is Liber AL vel Legis, sub figura CCXX, as delivered by XCIII=418 to DCLXVI, and it is commonly referred to as Liber AL vel Legis or just Liber Al. It contains three chapters, each of which was written down in one hour, beginning at noon, on April 8, April 9, and April 10.Crowley, Aleister. The Equinox of the Gods. == Notes == == References == * == Other websites == * OTO-USA scans of the Manuscript version of The Book of the Law * The Old and New Commentaries to Liber AL Category:1900s books Category:Spiritual books Category:1904 works
title: The Book of the Law
